course_title: Current Topics In Bioscience: Evolution of Primate Brains
class_notes:
(Same as ANT 585 3)
This course will trace the evolution of the primate neural systems, based primarily on comparative neuroanatomical evidence.  Topics will include:  mechanisms of evolutionary change in neural systems; mammalian brain specializations; brain changes that accompanied primate origins; changes that accompanied the evolution of the New World and Old World monkeys; and ape and human brain specializations.  Sensory systems will be surveyed - especially the visual system, which was highly modified in primate evolution, as well as sensorimotor, limbic, and higher-order association systems. 
This course meets with ANT 385-2 Evolution of Primate Brains
sections: Class Nbr: 5771, Section #: 3, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: TTh 11:30a-12:45p, Instructor: T. Preuss, Status: Open
